answers.author: Michael Conti
answers.text:
I am interested in any information you obtain.  As the IT manager for Health & Human Services, we will be required to perform such a test in the coming year as part of our HIPAA/HITECH risk assessments.

answers.author: Josh C
answers.text:
Hi Timothy:
I personally know of a few states and cities that have done penetration tests and vulnerability assessments. As a cyber security professional, I personally cringe when my competitors run a "vulnerability scan" and call that a penetration test.
Hi Michael:
I work with Net Force. We offer network vulnerability assessments and penetration testing services. I would appreciate the opportunity to bid when the need arises.
Please feel free to reach out to me at contact@net-force.net or at 951-638-3672 for any preliminary discussions. I am in the office Monday to Friday from 9AM to 7PM Pacific Time.

answers.author: Cayce Hanger
answers.text:
We reached out to a couple of companies; Illumant and Global Data Guard. We haven't firmly decided yet, but I believe we are leaning toward the latter.
illumant.com
globaldataguard.com

author: Timothy Blakeslee
text:
Hello,
The City of Dublin is going to do a network vulnerability/penetration test sometime next year. This is essentially where a firm that tries to hack into the City network to test the level of security. 
I was inquiring if any other communities have done such a test?  If you have, would be possible to contact you and converse about your experience?
Any help would be greatly appreciated!
Thank you,
Timothy Blakeslee
title: Network vulnerability/penetration testing
